media.caption: The secret passage at Schloss Leopoldskron, Salzburg, Austria

text.headline: TimelineJS Media Types
text.text: TimelineJS supports many media types. This provides a simple way to test them all. This page tests a simple image on a remote server.

media.caption: the Monkey section of David Van Tieghem's Ear Drums

text.headline: YouTube Videos
text.text:
if Timeline finds a URL that starts with 'youtube.com' or 'youtu.be', it will try to use it to embed a YouTube video. The protocol part of the URL (e.g. https://) is technically optional.

You can start at a specific point in the video using the t=#m#s parameter: see http://youtubetime.com/

media.caption: Phat Tai, a story of Vietnamese fishermen on the Gulf Coast.

text.headline: Vimeo
text.text: To embed a Vimeo video, just copy the URL of the Vimeo.com page which shows the video.

media.caption: The History of Advertising in 60 Seconds

text.headline: DailyMotion
text.text: To embed a DailyMotion video, just copy the URL of the page which shows the video.
